rows.title: Add Ground Rules to the WhatsApp Group Description

title.eng: Add Ground Rules to the WhatsApp Group Description

text.eng:
Remember to add the ground rules to the WhatsApp Group Description. 

​​To add the ground rules to the Group Description, copy the following ground rules or use the ones agreed during the onboarding session: 

“To make this a safe space for everyone, here are some ground rules:
 
✅ What is said in the group stays in the group. You need to know that this group is private.
✅ Accept each other. Everyone is different and has different experiences.
✅ Share only what you feel comfortable sharing.
✅ Feel free to ask questions!
✅ Respect privacy of personal pictures and videos that are sent to the chat group. 


Open the WhatsApp group chat. 

Tap the group name. 

Tap the existing description, or tap Add Group Description. 
Paste the ground rules. 

Tap Save.

rows.title: Identifying Group Admin

text.eng:
This week you will also ask the group to choose two group admin to keep the WhatsApp Support Group ongoing. 

The WhatsApp groups are designed to support parent engagement in the NKText chatbot. 

Select the 2 parents who receive the most votes to lead the group.

rows.text:

rows.title: What’s inside the Facilitator Guide?

text.eng: This guide is for YOU! It is a comprehensive guide to help you deliver Naungan Kasih to families around you. It includes steps on how to introduce caregivers to the programme, and support them, and specific information on the programme’s content.

rows.text: This guide is for YOU! It is a comprehensive guide to help you deliver Naungan Kasih to families around you. It includes steps on how to introduce caregivers to the programme, and support them, and specific information on the programme’s content.

rows.title: What to remember?

text.eng:
It is important to follow this manual as closely as possible. However, manuals are only a guide to support you after what you have learned in the training workshop. 
Remember, HOW you facilitate matters most. Delivering the content is only about 20% of the programme’s success. The other 80% depends on HOW you facilitate–your attitude, your empathy, and how you connect with and support parents throughout their journey.

rows.text:
It is important to follow this manual as closely as possible. However, manuals are only a guide to support you after what you have learned in the training workshop. 
Remember, HOW you facilitate matters most. Delivering the content is only about 20% of the programme’s success. The other 80% depends on HOW you facilitate–your attitude, your empathy, and how you connect with and support parents throughout their journey.

rows.title: Skills you need

text.eng: The core skills of a good facilitator are a mirror for parents to learn how to bring about the change we want to see in parents and the community. These include understanding stages of child development, praising and encouraging parents, using active listening skills, being consistent and compassionate, exploring problems, and finding solutions together.

rows.text: The core skills of a good facilitator are a mirror for parents to learn how to bring about the change we want to see in parents and the community. These include understanding stages of child development, praising and encouraging parents, using active listening skills, being consistent and compassionate, exploring problems, and finding solutions together.

rows.title: ⭐ Remember

text.eng:
Just as we say to the parents, “It is what you do at home that makes the difference,” the same thing applies to you: “It is how you interact with the parents in your group that makes the difference.” 

If you take the time to deliver a session before it begins, you will be more confident. If there is anything that you cannot remember or feel unsure of, contact another facilitator to practise with. 

Access the Facilitator Guide for your group by clicking on the icon above. .

rows.title: Create a WhatsApp Group

text.eng:
**Make sure you have done the following before the onboarding session starts:** 

- **Save parents’ names and WhatsApp numbers** (if available) on your phone, so you can confirm details during the in-person session.
- **Create your WhatsApp group** with a temporary name, icon, and description. You can keep the temporary name or update it once the group agrees on a name.
The group name should be in this format: 
“Naungan Kasih_[GROUP NAME]”. 

For example, “Naungan Kasih_HappyFamilies”

rows.text:
**Make sure you have done the following before the onboarding session starts:** 

- **Save parents’ names and WhatsApp numbers** (if available) on your phone, so you can confirm details during the in-person session.
- **Create your WhatsApp group** with a temporary name, icon, and description. You can keep the temporary name or update it once the group agrees on a name.
The group name should be in this format: 
“Naungan Kasih_[GROUP NAME]”. 

For example, “Naungan Kasih_HappyFamilies”

rows.title: Conduct Chat Session

text.eng:
**Before conducting chat sessions, make sure you:** 

- Create a WhatsApp Group during the onboarding session. 

- Identify the ground rules for the WhatsApp Group

**Structure for the chat session**: 

- Week 0 (after the onboarding session): Welcome, introductions, and reminder of home practice. 

- Week 2: Check-in: Connecting with parents on their progress with NKText, and discussion on child’s development and growth. 

- Week 4: Check-in: Connecting with parents on their progress with NKText, and discussion on supporting child’s learning in a fun and engaging way. 

- Week 6: Check-in: Connecting with parents on their progress with NKText, discussion on parent’s mental health, and identifying group admin to handover the group after final chat session.  

- Week 8: Final Chat Sessions: Sharing new group admin details, and closing.

**When to send the messages** 

- You and your group will decide a time to chat during the onboarding session.

- Each chat session has a reminder message (Message 1) that you should send a few hours before the chat session. 

- Send the remaining messages during the scheduled chat time.

rows.title: Share the Messages in Chat Session

title.eng: Share the Messages in Chat Session

text.eng:
- Look for the chat session for the week on the sessions page

- Find the specific week you want to share and click on it.

- Once you're on the content for that week, locate the "Share" icon. It should look like an arrow pointing upward or a box with an arrow, and it's used to share content. Click on the "Share" icon.

- In the menu that appears, select "WhatsApp" as your sharing option.

- Choose your Naungan Kasih Support Group from the list. 

- Before you hit the "Send" button, make sure to add or change any necessary information like your name. 

- Finally, click the "Send" button to share the content with your Naungan Kasih Support Group.

- Finally, click the "Send" button to share the content with your Naungan Kasih Support Group.

rows.title: Get Help with WhatsApp Support Group

title.eng: Get Help with WhatsApp Support Group

text.eng:
If you require help while moderating your WhatsApp Support Group, the weekly sessions provide a list of FAQ and potential solutions.

If you need support responding to a challenge shared by the parent during your weekly chat session, see “Common Challenges” on the homepage. 

Follow the same instructions as Sharing Chat Messages to share the solutions to the challenges. 

If you encounter a challenge not covered in the chat session, kindly contact your supervisor for further guidance.

rows.title: Help Parents Re-Enter the Group ID on NKText

title.eng: Help Parents Re-Enter the Group ID on NKText

text.eng:
Ensure the parent has finished onboarding onto NKText, then ask the parent to:
- Open NKText.
- Type **GROUP**. 
- Enter the group ID again.

rows.text:
Ensure the parent has finished onboarding onto NKText, then ask the parent to:
- Open NKText.
- Type **GROUP**. 
- Enter the group ID again.

rows.title: Ensure Parents Appear in Your Parent Group on FaciNK

title.eng: Ensure Parents Appear in Your Parent Group on FaciNK

text.eng:
Ensure that both your device and the parent’s device are connected to the Internet.

- If the parent is still onboarding onto NKText and at the prompt to enter the group ID, ask the parent to:
  - Enter the group ID and try again.

- If the parent is still onboarding onto NKText and has passed the prompt to enter the group ID, ask the parent to:
  - Finish onboarding onto NKText.
  - Type **GROUP**. 
  - Enter the group ID again.

- If the parent has finished onboarding onto NKText, ask the parent to:
  - Open NKText.
  - Type **GROUP**. 
  - Enter the group ID again.

rows.text:
Ensure that both your device and the parent’s device are connected to the Internet.

- If the parent is still onboarding onto NKText and at the prompt to enter the group ID, ask the parent to:
  - Enter the group ID and try again.

- If the parent is still onboarding onto NKText and has passed the prompt to enter the group ID, ask the parent to:
  - Finish onboarding onto NKText.
  - Type **GROUP**. 
  - Enter the group ID again.

- If the parent has finished onboarding onto NKText, ask the parent to:
  - Open NKText.
  - Type **GROUP**. 
  - Enter the group ID again.

rows.title: What to cover in the WhatsApp Call?

title.eng: What to cover in the WhatsApp Call?

text.eng:
Thank the parent for volunteering to lead the WhatsApp group.  

While engaging with other parents in the group, keep the following in mind:
🔵 Greet parents when engaging with them.
🔵 Respect what participants share and be aware of different ages, genders, values and circumstances.
🔵 Encourage parents to share and respond to each other - and praise them for it.
🔵 Remind parents of ground rules when needed.
🔵 Model the behaviour you want to see among the parents.

If the parent needs any prompts for discussion, share the following: 

Let us celebrate our successes! What was something positive you experienced when you tried one of the NKText skills with your child?

Trying out new skills can be hard at first. What was something difficult that you experienced when you tried a NKText skill with your child at home?
Remind the parent that they are not obligated to respond to messages all times. Participants may send messages at any time during the week. To keep your workload manageable, you can respond to messages once or twice a day, depending on your schedule. 

Ask them if they have any questions. 

Remind the parent that unfortunately, you will no longer be able to participate in the WhatsApp group.

rows.title: Set up your profile

text.eng:
- Go to Settings and click the Profile icon

- Type your name under “Your name” 

- Select your state from the dropdown menu 

- Tap Save

rows.text:
- Go to Settings and click the Profile icon

- Type your name under “Your name” 

- Select your state from the dropdown menu 

- Tap Save

rows.title: Add a Parent

text.eng:
During onboarding, you will share a 4-character group ID with your parents. When parents join NKText, they are prompted to enter this group ID that you share with them. When done, they should be automatically added to your parent group. 

What to do next?
- For each parent:
  - Click on the pencil icon to access the parent profile.
  - Add the First Name and Last Name. (Note: the “NKText ID” is the name that parents entered onto NKText during their onboarding.)
  - Click “Save”.

For information on how to troubleshoot adding a parent to your parent group using your group ID, see the guide on “How to Troubleshoot with Parents on Joining with My Group ID”.

rows.text:
During onboarding, you will share a 4-character group ID with your parents. When parents join NKText, they are prompted to enter this group ID that you share with them. When done, they should be automatically added to your parent group. 

What to do next?
- For each parent:
  - Click on the pencil icon to access the parent profile.
  - Add the First Name and Last Name. (Note: the “NKText ID” is the name that parents entered onto NKText during their onboarding.)
  - Click “Save”.

For information on how to troubleshoot adding a parent to your parent group using your group ID, see the guide on “How to Troubleshoot with Parents on Joining with My Group ID”.

rows.title: Add a Co-Parent

text.eng:
If two parents from the same family are participating in the programme, together, you must link their accounts. 

- In your parent group, click on the “Add Co-Parent” icon next to the parent’s name. 
- Select the co-parent from available parent user profiles. 

*Both parent profiles will be updated to note the co-parent.*

rows.text:
If two parents from the same family are participating in the programme, together, you must link their accounts. 

- In your parent group, click on the “Add Co-Parent” icon next to the parent’s name. 
- Select the co-parent from available parent user profiles. 

*Both parent profiles will be updated to note the co-parent.*

rows.title: Report Attendance

text.eng:
Select the Reports icon from the bottom navigation bar. 

Select the session you are reporting on.

Complete the report 

⏰Specify the time spent on preparation, travel, and actual session delivery. 

✅Check the activities you completed (onboarding) or number of messages you sent (WhatsApp Group)

🔵Selecting the parents who participated in the session:

For in-person sessions, “participation” is defined as parents who attended the session, in part or whole. 
For the WhatsApp group, “participation” is defined as parents who have sent at least 1 message (text, voice or video), emoji, sticker or GIF during the chat session. 

If you do not see a parent’s name, then you need to add that parent to the group (see above).

If you do not see a parent’s name, then you need to add that parent to the group (see above).

rows.title: Edit an Attendance Report

text.eng:
Only edit an attendance report if you have made a mistake. 

- Select the Reports icon from the bottom navigation bar. 
- Select the session you want to edit by clicking on the edit icon.
- Make your edits.
- Save your report.

rows.text:

- Select the session you want to edit by clicking on the edit icon.
- Make your edits.
- Save your report.
